content:
It's a quiet day in the quiet city of Honeyopolis, with a population of 14. It's far too quiet, actually.

You all congregate in the main street, Beehive Street, and discovered the body of Klazam, the town's mayor. A pool of blood is spreading around him. You all notice that he's clutching a note. The note says:

Evil has invaded our fair little town. Root it out!

You all look at each other with suspicion. Suddenly, Klazam cries out, "Lynch those no-good mobsters!" then slumps back, once again dead. You all set up a gallows in the square and agree to meet here everyday until all the mobsters are discovered.

Spoiler: Alive/Dead

Ruleset

Rules Section 1: General Rules
1.1. No discussion of the game outside the thread will be allowed unless I explicitly say so.
1.2. Do not edit posts. Do not use invisible text. Do not use small text.
1.3. No quoting of PMs will be allowed. Claiming is allowed, but quoting role PMs is not. By the same token, NO quoting mod communication in the game thread.
1.4. No discussion of the game in thread will be allowed following the game being put into night. However, the day does not end until I verify that a lynch has occurred.
1.5. No discussion of ongoing games will be permitted.
1.6. A basic level of civility will be required of all players. If personal attacks reach an excessive level, action will be taken.
1.7. At my discretion, modkills will be issued for the breakage of these rules depending on the intent and severity of the error. Modkills will convert a player to neutral survivor, and either not end or end the day, at my discretion. I will make sure that modkills are harmful to your faction.
1.8. Any type of claiming mafia partners as any alignment will result in a modkill, regardless of alignment. Don't do it.
1.9. Intentionally provoking a player in an attempt to get him or her modkilled or otherwise using modkills for strategic purposes will result in a modkill against the person using it as a tactic.

Rules Section 2: Voting, Deadlines, and Prods
2.1. All votes should be bolded and in the following format: Vote: [PLAYERNAME]. Likewise, if you are already voting for someone, please unvote before voting again, in a format like this: Unvote, vote: [PLAYERNAME].
2.2. Players may vote to end the day without a lynch by a majority of them voting for a no lynch.
2.3. Upon the majority of players voting for a particular player, a lynch will occur. If, at deadline, a majority has not been reached, no-lynch will occur.
2.4. Deadlines will be as follows: 2 weeks will be allowed per day. No extensions will be allowed except due to extenuating circumstances. Night actions must be received within 48 hours of a day's end. This means that night phases are roughly 50 hours long. If no night action is received, it will be randomized.
2.5. Failure to post within a 72 hour period will result in a prod. Failure to respond to a prod within 48 hours will result in replacement. After being prodded 3 times, unless your activity has made up for it otherwise, you will be force replaced if you need a fourth prod.

Rules Section 3: Other Rules
3.1. Cryptography (using ciphers) is forbidden, but stenography is allowed. If not sure, PM me first.
3.2. After you're dead, stop talking.
3.3. There is no rule 3.3.
3.4. Everything is randomized.
3.5. I am not infallible. If I make a mistake, please PM me or point it out in the thread.
3.6. This is my color, do not use it.
3.7. Play to win, but still have fun.
3.8. This is the Sample Vanilla Townie Role PM:

Rolename: Vanilla Townie
Alignment: Town
Passive Actions: None
Active Actions: None
Factional Actions: None
Win condition: You win when there are no threats to the town left in the game, and at least one town-aligned player is alive.

Please confirm by PM
Great. All role PMs are out. Please confirm by PM. The game will start on Friday, 4 PM EST.

Flavor

All of you meet under the newly erected gallows, silently, glancing at each other and wondering who would be the one to start a bloodthirsty mob going.

Day One: Vote Count One

Not voting: (13) – Beck, Captain Spoon, Ivan the Pleasant, YankCan151, Greymarble, rblinker123, SleepyKrew, The Kool, Acronach, ICEninja, Tommy, ConfidAnon, subgenius

With 13 alive, it’s 7 to lynch.

The deadline is Friday July 8, 4 PM EST.

Interesting. I think I'm going to like this game.

Anyways, I usually ask some questions to get the ball rolling in games then make a totally exaggerated case on something like word choice on page 1 in order to get the ball rolling further. My job has been done for me, it seems.

I would like to ask one question of everyone, though. What is your timezone? I like to take note of those outside of USA times as they generally post at strange hours. It's always good to know when waiting for a post from someone in Australia that they'll likely be posting in the middle of the night. I'm in PDT right now, which is GMT-8 or something like that.

The initial case on Beck was an anti-RVS case. There was zero ground for any real suspicion, and his joke was just a joke. I actually chuckled a little when I saw that as the first post. The initial case on Yank has, by itself, little to no true value in a case. However, should Beck flip scum, I agree that it is an associative tell.

I don't even want to be lynched, but if that's what it takes to realize he's opportunistic scum, then we probably don't have much hope as town anyways.

There's no debating that Yank is being overly defensive here, which I've seen cited more than once as a scum tell, but I find myself reading it as a newbie tell. He reminds me of myself in my first game after a long hiatus, in which I was subjected to some early pressure. GreyICE (of GreyMarble) was in that game, and might recall it. Like Yank, I became a bit hysterical and assumed my accusers were scum. As it turned out, they weren't scum, and neither was I.

At the moment, I'm sensing that Yank is an inexperienced and frazzled townie rather than a flailing scum.

I'll do my best to clarify.

There are 4 possible scenarios:
1)Yank is a town mason, telling the truth. In this case, it is absolutely inevitable that he will be cleared before lylo by 1 of 2 things: his own death and flip of mason, or a mason buddy's flip who can vouch for him. At some point, day 3 is usually a good time, the mason team will claim and clear Yank, giving us a ridiculously small poor of possible scum to lynch from.

2)Yank is lying scum and there is a mason team present in town. In this case, at some point one of the town masons will come forward saying "I am a town mason, and Yank is not in our mason team, lynch the lying scum!" and we lynch Yank. Town masons absolutely need to do this by day 3, day 2 would be preferable. Day 2 is absolutely required if only a single mason pair is left alive, as if we have a 2 man mason team that dies before outing Yank he could be incorrectly cleared as town.

3)Yank is lying scum and there is no mason team present in town. In this case, Yank's scum buddies can obviously not clear him as mason as they would out the entire scum team and give town a 100% victory. Yank stays alive night after night with no one to vouch for him and by day 3 or so it becomes crystal clear that he's lying scum and we lynch him. Gain for town.

4)Yank is lying town. I wouldn't normally include this, but I've played with too many fucking idiots who claim a power role as VT. If this is the case, Yank needs to immediately retract his claim, and admit to being a VT, as VTs claiming power role literally wins games for scum.

Giitah wrote:I'm pretty sure I understand what a hydra is (it's two accounts under one player, right?)

It's actually the opposite: two (or more) people posting from the same account. Each of these people has an account of their own, and sometimes they accidentally post from their personal account. So archaebob, Twistedspoon and so on are one-person accounts who shouldn't be posting in this game, but their owners are members of hydras who should. As Beck points out, if you assume that archaebob and Ivan are the same person, you'll get into trouble because that hydra has some... internal issues.
